dev-library.title: Dev Library
dev-library.description: You have just learned the basics of Docusaurus and made some changes to the initial template.

payments/basic-info.title: Basic Info
payments/basic-info.description: Using payments API you can easily receive bitcoin payments on your custom website. Payments go directly to your bitcoin wallet. To get registered click on Get started for free on the Merchants Page. Feel free to consult below resources:

payments/btc-price.title: BTC Price
payments/btc-price.description: Docusaurus creates a page for each blog post, but also a blog index page, a tag system, an RSS feed...

payments/checkouts.title: Checkouts
payments/checkouts.description: Docusaurus creates a page for each blog post, but also a blog index page, a tag system, an RSS feed...

payments/http-callback.title: HTTP Callback
payments/http-callback.description: Add Markdown or React files to src/pages to create a standalone page:

search/history.title: History
search/history.description: Returns the transaction history of multiple Bitcoin addresses/xpubs by considering them part of the same wallet. For each transaction, the following parameters are returned:

search/limits.title: Limits
search/limits.description: You can query max 100 addresses at a time. For higher number you should upgrade your plan and set your API Key in HTTP authorization header. Please limit API calls to 2 requests/min. Higher rates can lead to banning of your IP. Bitcoin blocks only arrive at an average rate of once in 10 minutes. So querying multiple times a second won't return you any new data. For realtime transaction updates on address, use our websocket API.

search/transaction-detail.title: Transaction Detail
search/transaction-detail.description: Returns detail of input transaction id. A list of transaction inputs and outputs are returned. Time is the received unix timestamp of transaction, value is the amount of transaction input/output in satoshis, fee is the transaction fees in satoshis, size is the transaction size in bytes. For unconfirmed transactions an RBF attribute may be returned.

search/transaction-receipt.title: Transaction Receipt
search/transaction-receipt.description: Transaction receipt is an easy to share permalink for any bitcoin transaction/payment. User addresses in the transaction are highlighted and net amount is calculated accordingly.

wallets-and-stores/stores.title: Stores
wallets-and-stores/stores.description: The Stores API lets you interact with all your stores, including creating, retrieving, updating & deleting, as well as attaching wallets to a store. You can use the parameter wallets=true with the Stores endpoint to retrieve the attached wallets of the stores.

wallets-and-stores/wallets.title: Wallets
wallets-and-stores/wallets.description: You can work with your wallets in Blockonomics with the Wallets API, including creating, retrieving, updating & deleting. In GET request, you can use balance=true to retrieve wallet balance as well.
